1:
Yahweh, think about what has happened to us.\q2 See how no one respects us any longer.
\q1
2:
Foreigners have seized our property,\q2 and now they live in our homes.
\q1
3:
Our enemies have killed our fathers,\q2 and caused our mothers to become widows.
\q1
4:
Now they make us pay for water to drink,\q2 and pay for firewood.


\q1
5:
The enemy runs after us and is very close to us;\q2 we are exhausted, but they do not allow us to rest.
\q1
6:
In order to get enough food to remain alive,\q2 we begged Egypt and Assyria to help us.
\q1
7:
Our ancestors sinned, and now they are dead,\q2 but we are suffering for the sins that they committed.


\q1
8:
Now the people who rule over us are themselves slaves to their own masters in Babylon.\q2 There is no one who can rescue us from their power.
\q1
9:
We go far to look for food, but we are in danger of dying when we do so,\q2 because of the robbers who live in the wilderness.
\q1
10:
Our skin has become hot like an oven,\q2 and we have a very high fever because we are extremely hungry.


\q1
11:
Our enemies have violated the women in Jerusalem,\q2 and they have done that to the young women in all the towns of Judea.
\q1
12:
Our enemies have hanged our leaders,\q2 and they have not respected our elders.


\q1
13:
They force our young men to grind flour with millstones,\q2 and young boys stagger while they are forced to carry heavy loads of firewood.
\q1
14:
Our elders no longer sit at the city gates to make important decisions;\q2 the young men no longer play their musical instruments.


\q1
15:
We are no longer joyful;\q2 instead of dancing joyfully, we now mourn.
\q1
16:
The wreaths of flowers have fallen off our heads.\q2 Terrible things have happened to us because of the sins that we committed.


\q1
17:
We are tired and discouraged,\q2 and we cannot see well because our eyes are full of tears.
\q1
18:
Jerusalem has no one living any more in it,\q2 and jackals prowl around in it.


\q1
19:
But Yahweh, you rule forever!\q2 You continue to rule from one generation to the next generation.
\q1
20:
So why have you forgotten us?\q2 Will you abandon us for a very long time?
\q1
21:
Please enable us to return to you,\q2 and enable us to prosper as we did previously.
\q1
22: Please do that, or is it really true that you have rejected us forever?\q2 Is it really true that you will never stop being extremely angry with us?
